inn1.comm: full at off stump, defended square towards point
pushes this down the leg side, Pakistan off the mark
beats him with a good one, back of a length and nips past the inside edge...Buttler can't gather cleanly
full, pushed across outside off, 86mph, Aslam holds his bat inside the line
full at off stump, Aslam forcing himself forward as he defends
left alone outside off
works this away from just outside off down to long leg
starts on a good length at off stump, defended to the covers
squares him up a touch outside as he defends to point
good length, full at off stump, defended into midwicket

there's an appeal for caught behind as he goes for the pull, there's a noise as it passes the batsman. Given not out and England review. Close to glove. We'll need Hot Spot and Snicko for this. No mark on Hot Spot. Will be down to RTS now. Well, there is a spike. Is it enough? Third umpire, Simon Fry, having one more look and it's overturned!
back of a length, defended to midwicket
outside off, left alone...decent carry
full at middle and off, 89mph, defended to cover

what a ball! That's one for the scrapbook from Wood. Not doubt there. Pitches full on middle (maybe even leg stump) moves away late off the seam and knocks back off stump.Blimey, yes, that ball from Wood pitched well outside leg
full at off stump, defended to cover
gets into line and defends...he's cranking up the speedgun again
back of a length, this is shaping back at the right hander and it's left
a flat-footed drive, full outside off, Azam chases it well away from his body...Pakistan all over the place at the moment

and another! This going from bad to worse for Pakistan. It's back of a length, nips away down the slope, bounces a touch and takes the edge. Lovely bowling, Azhar did not do much wrong. High-quality from England's quicks
short of a length, Sarfraz already coming down the pitch, banged in by Woakes and it's defended to the off side
an appeal for lbw now as Sarfraz falls across a full delivery trying to play to leg but that's missing leg stump
past the edge again, although Sarfraz may have pulled his bat inside the line...Woakes using the slope
wide of third slip! Sarfraz chasing a wideish delivery, he wasn't in control, but managed to flash it out of reach of Stokes
short of a length, perhaps a bit too short, more movement but the batsman is able to hold the bat out of the line
full at off stump, 91mph, shaping in to the batsman who defends on the front foot
gets this through the off side, a solid front-foot drive, Sarfraz showing intent as ever, gets it wide of the cover fielder and it's timed nicely
comes forward again, reaching away from his pad, gets a controlled outside edge to third man
back of a length, a punchy back-foot drive from Azam, that's very nicely played...gets on top of the bounce
fuller, outside off, left alone
full again, outside off at 91mph, he lets it go through to the keeper
inside edge saves him! Full, straight, trying to drive and that was heading for middle stump except for the bit of bat that came first
trying to get across his stumps, flicked to midwicket where Moeen makes a good save
on middle and off, defended down the pitch...this is exemplary stuff from Woakes
fuller, at the stumps, driven firmly back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, playing away from his body a little, takes a thick outside edge but goes to ground in front of Stokes who is now at fourth slip
finishes the over with a fuller one at the stumps, driven to mid-on...another maiden for Woakes
a few bonus runs for Pakistan as Wood bangs in a bouncer which loops through to Buttler then bursts through his gloves. Not quite sure how that happened. A bit careless
back of a length, defended
short of a length, he opens the face and runs it to third man
another one angled to third man
that's a loose delivery, dragged short and wide, Azam slashes it square through the off side ...Roy will think he should have stop that, dived over it at point
back on a full length at off stump, 91mph, defended
an appeal for lbw as this nips back off a good length and strikes Sarfraz around the knee roll...looked to be angling down. Maybe high, too. Hawk Eye says clipping top of leg stump
a bouncer, angles over leg stump, and called a wide
walks forward and defends to cover
back of a length, takes the splice of the bat with Sarfraz always keen to get forward
punched off the back foot to the off side, bounces nicely for point which means he can have a shy at the stumps and that would have been close with a hit
good delivery, full at off stump, defended to cover
latches on to a full ball, drives through the line and threads it between cover and mid-off...some confidence-boosting boundaries in the last few overs
short of a length, dropped to the off side in front of point...Roy has another shy but this is a safe single and it requires some good backing up
full at off stump, 88mph, defended solidly to the covers
flicked off the pads in front of square, it runs away but Moeen is able to flick it back just inside the rope
that's nicely played again, gets too straight, flicked wide of mid-on and that's some very poor running because they presumed it had gone for four. Schoolboy stuff, really
short this time and pulled wide of mid-on, this time there's enough legs on the short to run into the boundary...think he was running harder this time
back on a full length outside off, 91mph, driven firmly to mid-off
full outside off, defended towards backward point
another one through the off side, too full, he drives it between cover and mid-off...think England's quicks have forced it a little since those early wickets
that's an even better shot! Just places his bat on the ball, a lovely piece of timing square of the wicket
drags the length back, defended to backward point
defends from off stump to point
full outside off, left alone
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
goes back to a short ball and drives to the off side
nice delivery, held back a touch, uses his feet then defends
full outside off, driven to the sweeper
that's well played, a shorter delivery, he goes back then plays it with a straight bat through mid-on...long-off gets around
wider outside off, can't beat backward point as he cuts
more invention from Sarfraz as he comes down the pitch outside off then flicks through midwicket...brings up a very exciting counterattacking fifty stand
back of a length outside off, walking at the bowler, plays towards point...he's all-action at the crease
width outside off, he places it down to third man and that's some excellent running this time
comes forward, drives to point, a pointless shy at the non-striker's end from Roy which then cannons off the stumps and away for runs
good yorker, Sarfraz jabs down on it
goes for the yorker again, angling leg side this time, clipped through midwicket
touch shorter, he opens the face and places through the off side
dragged down short, he rocks back and pulls firmly but picks out deep midwicket
wider outside off, he comes down the pitch and reaches for it, drives to deep cover
we are going to the TV umpire for a run out but think he's safe...was cut through point, deep cover quickly on it, decent throw but Azam is comfortably back
angled in at leg stump, played back to the bowler
quite full but he's cutting again, sends it to deep point

that's an odd shot, almost spoons a return catch to Plunkett...it was short outside off, he went for the pull but then tried to abort the shot and the ball looped back down the pitch but out of the reach of the bowler
edged off the back foot but wide of the lone slip to third man
full at middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket
got through him! A full delivery, Azam was aiming to play it through the leg side, gets a thick inside edge into his boot which then rolls back to the stumps
full outside off, 92mph, pushed firmly to cover
onto the front foot at a length ball, defended to cover who dives to make the save
good footwork, makes this into a full toss which he whips wide of midwicket
some slow turn outside off, driven from the back foot to the sweeper
nicely bowled, full at middle and off, he props forward
drifts outside leg stump, clipped off the pad behind square
short delivery, he goes back and drives to cover
quite full, slightly dangerously he is playing back but manages to drive to the sweeper again
a bouncer, outside off, that might have been close to a wide...hmm, yes, that should have been a wide
angled on the pads, clipped behind square...just pad, actually
opens the faces and drives this towards point
back of a length, on off stump, defended to the covers
on a length outside off, played square to the off side
driven on the up to the covers without much timing
goes down on his back knee and does well to pull this delivery as it skidded on a touch
stops in the surface a touch as Malik drives to cover
full at middle, pushed wide of a diving Rashid
goes back to a shorter delivery and punches this wide of Rashid again
takes a thick inside edge to the leg side
down the pitch, pushes to deep midwicket
shovelled through the leg side
pushed to point
takes his bottom hand off the bat as he works to the leg side
short of a length, gets inside the line and tucks to the leg side
short ball, he's quickly on to that, pulls well in front of square
banged in short at off stump, well bowled and well play as he takes his bottom hand off the bat to keep the ball down
brings him forward and it takes an inside edge to the leg side
full at the stumps, driven down to long-off
short ball but he misses out, rocks back and pulls, picks out midwicket
much fuller, sweeps to deep square leg
that's a nice piece of batting, deft touch, guides this from outside off fine of short third man
full outside off, hint of turn, pushed to the covers
banged in short, deflected into the leg side with a hop
forward and defended into the off side
full length, hint of width, a nice wristy drive into the covers to pick off the single
back of a length, angling in, and defended with a leap into line
on the pads and flicked square
that's a fantastic diving stop at backward point, a wristy full-blooded cut and Roy is on his toes once more. An appreciative thumbs-up from Plunkett
tossed onto a good length, a compact drive to mid-on
patted back down the track to the bowler
an ambitious slog-sweep from outside off, but the ball never quite reached him. Skewed out to backward square all the same
tapped out to point as Stokes hares in from the rope to limit the damage
down the track, a full-blooded wallop and though he doesn't connect perfectly, Sarfraz bissects the gap at wide long-on to perfection to motor along to 49...
poked to point, a quick call, and there is his fifty. He's looked their likeliest momentum-seizer for much of the summer and today he's coming good. Shabash
slow turn from outside off, nudged to point
down the track, a hefty lofted drive over the covers, and the first six of the day! Moeen once again coming under the pump from the outset
clipped to leg
turning from the straight, sliding down the leg side and helped round the corner. Sarfraz slipped as he was setting off for the single. A direct hit might have been tight...  very tight!
off stump line, more gentle turn, helped to square leg
forward and blocked back to the bowler
opens his stance to press a drive up to mid-on
whisked off the toes out to deep midwicket
opens the face, clipped down to third man
onto the front foot, punched into the covers
stoutly forward and blocked back down the track
width, and chopped square to bring up the fifty stand. Another useful effort, given the tatters at the top of Pakistan's innings
fully forward and pushed back to the bowler
beaten outside off as he aims through point with a bit of a waft
shuffling feet, makes some room outside off, and clobbers a back-foot drive through point. Well placed
a bit more flight, drawn forward
standing tall on the back foot, and pushing into the gap at midwicket
slightly short, Sarfraz hauls a pull from outside off down to long-on, to keep the strike
forward and blocked out to point
angled into the pads and chipped into the leg side. In the air for a while but safely into the gap
definite shape back into the right hander, who tightens up to defend to cover
tapped out to point, off the back foot, and a sharp call
shorter, and a bit of lift outside off, as Shoaib thinks about a dabbed cut but thinks again
deflected down to third man, a threatening over from Wood
using the feet once more, pushed to mid-on
more gentle turn from outside off, Sarfraz looking eager to get a move on
a delicate late cut to steal a single through third man
on the pads, can't quite nurdle it away
tossed up, a fraction slower through the air, clipped to midwicket to complete a decent over
more threatening swing through the air

there it is! Wood has earned that wicket. This is just back of a length, kicks sharply off the deck and grazes the edge of a non-committal back-foot push. Tight line, good pace, disarming movement. He's using all his tricks today
round the wicket, angled into the pads, and worked into the leg-side
onto the front foot, driven firmly to short cover
wide of the crease with a late Devon Malcolm-esque leap in delivery stride. Doesn't quite find a way through, but tapped to cover with caution
angled down to third man. Wood is proving quite the impact bowler today
tapped back down the pitch
turning from middle to leg and helped to midwicket
fully forward, pushed to cover
more tight lines to the left hander
forward and blocked
good finale, forcing a tight block on off stump. Moeen drying up the runs nicely now
squared up by a full length delivery on the pads. Sharp pace again
a bit of width, and eased into the covers with a free-flowing drive
soundly tonked into the off side
angled defence out to point
onto the front foot, punched to mid-off
another fine constraining over. Imad can do little but get behind the line to defend
aggressive intent, but Moeen drags back his length to demand a defensive push despite a gallop down the track
back on the stumps this time, and nurdled square
round the wicket, on the toes, flicked fine
late-cut through third man, where a bit of a fumble gifts the single
round the wicket, drawn forward, poked back to the bowler
a bit of lift outside off, well kept down on the back foot
speared into the pads, deflected out to the leg side
round the wicket, and once again Imad tightens up on off stump to defend. Decent deliveries, but a nigh-on-perverse lack of intent
a run this time, angled down to third man as Plunkett offers a bit of width
indrift, and flicked with the angle out to deep midwicket
a bit of a loose waft outside off, slip is excited but no edge
tight defence on the back foot. Imad has 19 overs left to bat out for an heroic draw ...
eww, that's a bit minging from Roy at deep midwicket. A gentle flick off the toes, and a slide on the edge of the rope. But the ball slithers through everything!
swept, top-edged, and the ball briefly lodges in the grille! No damage done
down on one knee to sweep
poked back down the pitch
on the back foot, a gentle push to mid-off
ambitious gallop down the track, but Sarfraz can't really connect with his heave-ho across the line. Deflected to square leg
on the pads, nudged squsre
round the wicket, back of a length, deflected off the splice out to short midwicket
outside off, dabbed to third man
full length and swinging away late, good variation, and Sarfraz adjusts his drive to dab to gully
on the pads, and flicked to midwicket
on the pads, sliding down, tucked around the corner
another tight delivery
worked into the gap for a rare single
appreciable turn from just outside off, worked into the leg side
a filthy bunt down the track, but somehow, Sarfraz's combination of eye, power, reach and luck turns a horrid miscalculated mow down the ground into a well-placed one-bounce four
can't get this one away
good running to keep the score creaking along
full outside off, pushed on the walk towards point
shorter in length, he opens the face down to third man
angled across the left hander, back of a length, slashed off a top edge down to third man
clipped off the pads to deep square leg, placed well for a second
opens the face to third man
on a length at off stump, defended towards mid-off
flicks a full delivery out to deep midwicket
round the wicket, full at off stump, defended to cover
full outside off, driven down the ground off somewhere close to the bottom of the bat
sweeps this from around middle stump, behind square, Woakes gets around but fumbles which allows a second...England's ground fielding not faultless today
cuts this off the stumps towards short third man
pushed to the covers
full outside off, can't beat cover
walks at the bowler, guided to backward point
gets forward and drives firmly towards mid-off who is on the edge of the circle
that's a flamboyant cut stroke from Imad, leaning back, slices it down to third man
short of a length, nips back at Sarfraz and takes him on the thigh pad
full, angled in at the stumps, flicked to deep square
comes down the pitch, Moeen drags the length back and Sarfraz can't get it away
sweeps and finds short fine leg but can scamper the single
gets away with this as he comes down the pitch, aims to go down the ground, slices off a thick outside edge but falls into space wide of long off
pushed along the ground to deep cover
misses his sweep this time, takes the glove and bounces into the helmet
tucked off the pads behind square
charges down the pitch, Woakes sees him, drops it in short and Sarfraz bails out of his pull, allowing the ball through to Buttler
on a length outside off, opens the face to third man
a flat-footed drive outside off as Woakes angles a full one across him
driven in the air behind point but splits the gap between gully and backward point
short of a length, tucked off his hip to deep square
gets his first boundary, that will help him, as he latches on to a short ball outside off and drags it through wide mid-on. Brings up the fifty stand
flicked off the pads behind square
dropped to the off side and can't get off strike
shorter outside off, he goes back and places it through point
sweeps this strongly but straight to deeps square
sees that mid-on is inside the circle and clears the man as he lofts a delivery from outside off
opens the face through point so he keeps the strike...and they get two bonus runs when the throw from the deep hits the stumps and rebounds away (again)
tucked off the stumps through midwicket
outside leg stump but Sarfraz clips it straight to short fine leg
gets the sweep out to a full delivery, sends it to deep square
tapped square to the off side
flicked in the air from outside off but it goes wide of Rashid as he dives across in his follow through
tight on off stump, pushed to the covers...quiet over
short on the hip, tickles it away, and that's his century! A fantastic innings...he does a jig of delight, then takes off his helmet and soaks in the standing ovation
short of a length, straighter this time, tucked to deep square
angled down to third man

he's been given lbw and reviews it straightaway. Has he hit it? Went a long way across his crease, struck him on back leg, no bat. Might be sliding down the leg side as it missed the front pad. And, yes, it's missing leg stump. Good call from Sarfraz. An off-cutter from Plunkett which gripped a little
short outside off, gets on top of the bounce and guides it to third man
nearly drags this on as he defends late and it comes off the inside part of the bat
that's creamed to cover where Roy can't stop it cleanly

almost out twice...goes for a swing to the leg side, takes a thick outside edge which lands short of backward point then he would have been out with a direct hit at the bowler's end as well. Plunkett's throw was poor, as was Rashid's position at the stumps
slog swept to deep midwicket
tucked off the pads
finds deep midwicket! Gets too far underneath his slog-sweep this time, and it doesn't have the legs to clear Hales who is on the boundary
short outside off, pushes it square towards point
full outside off, he has a swing a miss...important role for Imad now, he's used a lot of balls trying to rebuild the innings
that's good work at backward point by Roy as he cuts off a well-struck cut
full, outside off, goes for a drive but it comes off the bottom of the bat towards mid-off
on off stump, angled wide of the keeper down to third man
full, angled in at leg stump, takes the pad towards square leg
full outside off, driven through the covers
goes back to a short delivery and finds cover as he drives
full at the stumps, pushed to the off side

significant turn on this one, comes back in at Imad who nearly drags it on off stump inside edge. Well, we actually have an umpire review to see whether the inside edge went into the boot and was then caught by Buttler. Nope, it's off the ground. Move on, chaps
that's a decent club down the ground, bisects long-off and long-on
comes down the pitch then swings this out to deeps square leg
finishes with a googly, again grips a bit, defended to the on side...Yasir won't mind the sight of that over
well, he's done tremendously with that, hoicks this away over deep point and it carries all the way...a short delivery and got underneath it
now he goes down the ground, Plunkett goes fuller and gets dispatched with a crunching straight drive
round the wicket, big full toss, and Imad gets it between cover and mid-off to take him to a fifty...he's cutting loose to give Pakistan a chance
slower ball, full outside off, driven down the ground to long-on
he has a swing and a miss across the line at a length delivery

oh dear! This could be nasty...the catch has been taken in the deep by Joe Root but he collides with Rashid as both of them were looking at the ball. Root is holding his ankle. He did very well to hold on. Hasan got a big leading edge from a back-of-a-length delivery high into the leg side. Looks as though Root's ankle may have twisted.
works a length ball to the leg side, that's what he's to do, feed Imad the strike
he follows Imad as he gives himself room outside and this ends up striking his backside
angled on the pads, flicked behind square and he's able to get the strike back...Root in action
whipped through midwicket, he wanted the second but it's not on
full and straight, an appeal for lbw as Wahab flicks across the line but it's heading down on the angle
backing miles outside leg again, he's almost off the cut strip, cloths this down the ground but it means he keeps the strike
gets a yorker in, Imad can't get it past the bowler
full outside off, driven firmly to cover, the throw comes in and Woakes takes off the bails but Imad is home
full and straight, he's middled that drive brilliantly to beat deep cover...just short of the yorker Woakes wanted
whipped off the pads to deep square

he's moving all over the stop, Imad is right across outside off then tries to scoop this but gets in a tangle as Woakes follows him...he then doubles over in pain after completing the single. Went into his knee, missed the pad

what a stunner! Plunkett has pulled off a breathtaking catch at cover. Wahab connected well with a length delivery, came out of the middle, but Plunkett flung himself full-length to his left on the edge of the circle. He was horizontal when he took it. A blinder.
has that hit the same spot on the knee? Angled in from round the wicket, he went for the pull, and there's a cry of anguish from Imad
moving outside leg stump, lofts this down the ground where Stokes is lurking at long-on and keeps them to a single
that's a wayward one, speared down the leg side, and an excellent one-handed take from Buttler diving to his left

that's a massive slog, goes miles in the air, and gives a simple catch to cover...I know only a few balls left, but not sure that was entirely Yasir's best option. Was a slower ball, so some credit to the bowler as well
short ball, goes for the hook and gets it over Buttler down to fine leg...they'll take them any way they come
back of a length, pulled to deep midwicket...Amir has one ball to face
angled into the pads, deflect towards fine leg who manages to cut it off but Amir can make it back for the second which means Imad has the strike
low full toss which he slices to deep cover
length ball, on middle and leg, no room to work with and he can only play it down by his feet
another dot as he swings and misses at a slower ball outside off
he's connected just well enough to clear mid-off with this drive, beats a leaping Moeen Ali, and brings up Pakistan's 250
this comes out a little wrong, another slower ball, wide outside off stump

gets the yorker in this time, and there's a run out to end the innings...Woakes fielded off his own bowling, Imad had already set off to try and get the strike back. Woakes was about to hurl at the striker's end before realising he could walk up to the non-striker's stumps and take the bails off

inn2.comm: outside off, good carry, but no swing to speak of

inside edge, and Roy has gone for a duck! Perhaps playing for the swing that wasn't there, a loose push forward to a length delivery, and his stumps have been splattered! Well, well, if there was any scalp that Pakistan needed early, that was it! Game most definitely on ...
fully forward, pushing outside off again, but a thicker edge into the leg side
forward again, blocked into the off side
tight line, probing length, Root puts bat to ball and sprints a sharp single into the covers to get off the mark
outside off, pushed off the back foot into the covers
decent start, line and length on off stump, defended
outside off, back of a length, nipping in a touch and defended to point
bosh. That is a mighty biff through the covers. Just a nudge of width but he was onto the front foot in an instant, belting it on the up with a delicately bent back knee
shorter but equally wide, and you can't bowl there to Joe Root, especially with the slope taking the ball even wider
much better line, angling into the right hander and holding its own as Root advances into a front-foot block
well bowled, a good finish to the over. Slightly wide, but nibbling back off the seam to beat Root's drive on the inside edge
back of a length, on the hip, tucked square
through to the keeper, tight line again
firmly struck on the front foot, but straight to cover
tight line, nipping from leg to off, defended on the back foot
on the pads again, but tucked behind square this time. All change in the cordon, personnel-wise, but Amir persists with two slips
tapped into the off side
full length, nipping in from a tight line. Root squares up in defence
skidding through outside off as Root is this time lured into an injudicious back-foot drive. Beaten by the bounce
he's equal to this one, half a step further down the track on this occasion, and guided with precision through the gap at wide mid-off
onto the front foot to drive again, but only as far as cover this time
back of a length, outside off, Root loiters inside the line and glides a controlled edge to third man
tighter line again, back and across to defend
firm defence and a loud shout of 'no!'
waits for the ball to arrive, and nudges another late deflection down through the cordon for another single
outside off, back of a length, still no movement back into the right-hander, but a solid rhythm building
forward and defended back to the bowler
too short, and Hales rolls into a controlled pull through backward square. His first boundary, and a well-placed one
forward to defend into the off side
forward and defended into the gap for another of Root's trademark stealth singles
nips back a touch into the pads as Hales defends
onto the front foot, drilled to cover
tight line, a suspicion of movement back into the right hander. Compact defence is the upshot
more helpful jag back into the right-hander. Hales defends with a bit of late adjustment
outside off and this one climbs off the deck to beat an ambitious back-foot push. Well bowled, a tidy over
up on the toes, punched to cover
whipped into the leg side but no way through there
full length, floated into the blockhole and clipped uppishly to midwicket
on the pads, flicked fine. That rushes away down the slope
tightens up this time, and Hales defends
width outside off, slashed down to deep backward point
onto the front foot, drilled to cover
outside off, lifting off the deck and tailing towards the cordon. A bit of a loose slash
beaten again, as this one nips back a touch. Good rhythm continues
Hales under the cosh a touch in this over, not quite got his timing going
nibbles into the pads, clipped to leg to escape the strike
tucked off the toes out to deep midwicket, Root is so light on his feet, he just ghosted down the wicket to help himself to a half-volley
round the wicket, darted into the toes, pushed to mid-off
good line and length again, met with a straight-faced push back up the wicket
shuffling across the crease, worked into the leg side
back of a length, punched off the toes to cover

filfty slog-sweep, and he's through the shot so early he might as well have continued his followthrough and swiped it at the second revolution! Stumps splattered, and another unconvincing innings ends to keep Pakistan in with a sniff ...
patted back to the bowler to end a successful over
a bit of an inside-edged drive but another run to the cause
probing line from leg to off, Morgan tightens up in defence
forward and driven into the covers
stands tall on the back foot to defend
patted out to point
worked down to third man, and England finish the first Powerplay in a spot of mild bother
drawn forward and pushed back to the bowler
on the pads, an easy nurdle to midwicket
round the wicket, outside off, patted out to point
low full toss, bunted up to mid-on
angled into the pads, patted into the leg side
worked into the leg side
open face, glided down to third man
fierce lift from a sharp back-of-a-length lifter, and Morgan is rapped on the glove. A leg gully would have been in business there...
outside off, and Root uses the pace to drill a measured drive out to deep cover. Good fielding to cut off the boundary
on the hip, tucked in front of square for another single
banged in short and a lovely tight line to force Morgan to flinch out of harm's way
outside off, tapped to point
round the wicket, Morgan rolls his wrists into his trademarked paddywhack reverse-sweep. Gets it very fine, but effective
outside off, tapped to point
down the track, clipped to midwicket
driven firmly into the covers, where a half-stop gifts England a second run
thumped to backward point
on the pads, worked up to mid-on
outside off, and pushed to backward point, using the pace of the ball to do his work for him
banged in short, but Morgan swishes into a pull, using the angle across his body to help the ball on its way through backward square
fuller length, tighter line, Morgan attempts a nurdle but can't get enough bat on it
forward and defended back down the pitch. Full face of the bat
solid defence
full length, looked like a slower ball, Morgan read it, whatever it was, and patted it into the covers
dabbed out to point.
on the pads, worked square
half an appeal as Morgan exposes his leg stump in an attempted flip over the shoulder
onto the front foot and pushed back to the bowler
forward and crunched through the covers, that'll make him feel better
faster and flatter, Morgan cuts to point and nearly causes his team-mate's run out for the second match running! This time the shy fizzes just wide though ...
firmly into line
fuiller length, slower ball. Mid-off climbs down to field the ball as if descending into the cellar
banged in short, and this time Morgan climbs into a round-house pull. A bit of top edge but only fine leg back from the stroke, and he beats him with a one-bounce four
dabbed into the leg side
on the hips, whipped in front of square
through to the keeper, a good finish to the over

starts with a ball back of a length which Root delightfully whips wide of mid-on, the timing is lovely, the fielder from deep midwicket is able to get around and flick it back, or was he in touch with the rope...TV having a look. He's okay.
on a length outside off, driven straight of mid-off
short again, outside off, plays a bottom-handed whip through midwicket
worked off the pads to square leg
takes this from outside off to the on side and Yasir can get across
a fairly flat delivery which he flips to midwicket
back of a length, opens the face behind point
full at off stump, 89mph, defended
full at off stump, driven to the covers
length at off stump, slides off the outer part of the bat to third man
comes round the wicket, full and straight, defended to midwicket
whips this from off stump to deep square
touch more flight, full on off stump, driven to point
brings out the slog-sweep, brought his downfall here in the Test match, but he connects well with this one, goes skimming just about the surface to deep midwicket
and he repeats the shot, fetched it from outside off, all along the deck this time and the man at deep midwicket makes a diving save
full at middle, played to the leg side
gets this very fine, a deft dab-sweep by Morgan, takes it from around off stump past the keeper
shorter delivery, flicked in the air off his pads for a little while but well short of square leg
pushes this back to the bowler
goes back to a shorter ball and works through square leg
beats him over the top edge as he goes to cut, perhaps not as short as he thought
driven towards cover
brings out the reverse sweep, connects well but straight to short third man
aims to work this to the leg side and almost gets a leading edge
very full on off stump, Root slog sweeps to deep midwicket
gone with a hit I think! Tucks a straight delivery towards square leg and, yes, miles out with a hit. More issues for this pair with the running
flicked behind square on the leg side
full on the pads, gets it through the infield this time so they can trot the single
more sloppy work in the field, Root drives this fairly gentle into the covers and Azhar can't get down to it
flicked from off stump to midwicket
uses his feet then whips down the ground to long-on
round the wicket, short of a length, pushed to long-off
dragged down short, Root gets a top edge as he sweeps but it avoids short fine leg
patted back to the bowler
swept off his pads to deep square leg to take him to fifty off 56 balls
short again and Morgan does very well to pull this through straight midwicket because it didn't quite get up off the surface. Watched it closely
swept from outside off to deep midwicket
gets down early and scoops this almost over his shoulder
a strangled appeal for lbw but that's not especially close, takes the pad to the leg side
uses his feet, drives towards mid-off
bowled a touch slower, hint of turn, Root dabs towards point
that's a very strong sweep from Morgan this time, takes it from outside off and it whistles through square leg
starts with a short delivery outside which gets cut to deep point
this shapes back at Morgan, is it reverse? Takes Morgan's pads towards gully
fuller, defended to the leg side
starts to walk at the bowler, Sarfraz-style, then dabs a back-of-a-length delivery behind point
full, pushed towards leg stump, takes the pad to the leg side
width outside off, Morgan cuts into the point area without any great timing
comes down the pitch then works this wide of the bowler to long-on
dragged down short, Root goes back and pulls but can't quite get it wide of mid-on as Sharjeel makes good ground to his right
full at the stumps, Morgan defends
another of those dab-sweeps which go very fine past the keeper towards fine leg
an appeal for lbw as this beats the inside edge, but hit him quite high...rebounds away towards short third man
another lbw appeal, but this time there's a bottom edge from Root as he sweeps which null and voids it
full at off stump, 87mph, driven back to the bowler
tucks a length delivery wide of mid-on
round the wicket, a big appeal for lbw as Root falls across his shot a little but it seemed to he heading leg side. Actually, height the issue
there's a yorker (he heard you) dug out towards mid-on who is deep enough for the single
chops this down to third man and takes the captain to fifty from 63 balls...first in 24 innings
that's a poor delivery, big full toss on the bats, Morgan gets a tickle on it and Sarfraz can reach it with a dive
almost drags this one on, trying to force off the back foot and gets a thick inside edge
stretches forward and tucks to midwicket
reverse sweep/swat to a delivery quite a way outside off, it's in the air but well clear of any fielders and runs to the backward point boundary
goes back to a shorter ball and plays to the bowler
some more uncertain running as Morgan flicks to backward square leg...Root sends him back
keeps a fraction low, or was fuller than Morgan thought, but he watches it closely and pushes to cover
some late shape in at Morgan, taken on the pad but it's heading down leg
full outside off, played into the pitch and cover is quickly in
full at off stump, defended
steers this to backward point
full and straight, Morgan can't beat mid-on...five dot balls (not quite the same as Binny's five sixes)
well bowled, fuller, shaping in at the pads and that may have taken a bit of inside edge...good over
flicks a full ball behind square and a good piece of a running to make a couple...hundred stand between this pair
goes back and gets a thick inside edge into his pads
gets over the top of this one and flicks through midwicket
gives himself room to the leg side and cuts this off the stumps in front of square...excellent use of the crease from Morgan
on the pads and he flicks it towards fine leg
dabbed behind square on the off side
back in the attack, starts full at off stump, pushed to mid-on
wide outside off, back of a length, guided to third man
round the wicket, full outside off, driven to mid-off
flicks this off the stumps to mid-on
a loopy bouncer, deliberate slower ball, Root tries to pull it around the corner but is through his shot. Awkward take for Sarfraz
that's sweetly struck by Root, pulls a back-of-a-length delivery in front of square
skips out of his crease, not quite to the pitch, comes off the bottom of the bat through midwicket
he's broken through! Imad is pumped! Trying to give himself some room as in the previous over, but this ball was a touch fuller, skids on and goes under Morgan's bat
full and straight, clipped to midwicket
pushes down the ground to get off the mark
another one skids on, Root playing back and clips to midwicket...he needs to be a little careful
clips to midwicket
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended
pushed into the leg side and mid-on can prevent the single...ball is certainly offering something for Wahab
that's a top shot, a bottom-handed whip wide of mid-on from a full ball outside off with Wahab round the wicket
good length, 88mph, at off stump and Stokes defends
fuller, he drives and gets a thick inside to the leg side
round the wicket, very full, dug out to the covers
full outside leg stump, Stokes sweeps it powerfully through square leg
straighter delivery, a firm bottom-handed clip back to Imad who can only parry the ball away
a reverse sweep, the ball was outside off, gets it fine of short third man
goes back in the crease to a short ball and whips to midwicket, good work by Yasir at midwicket who has been livewire in the field on this tour
clipped to deep midwicket
round the wicket, full outside off, driven to mid-off
back of a length, gets inside the line and tucks through square leg
short outside off, Stokes cracks it to deep cover
bottom hand into play again as he whips this from around off stump to deep square
goes for the inswing yorker, just gets it a fraction wrong, it's given runs as he glances down to fine leg...think it was just pad, so a bonus for Stokes
tries again, he's not far off getting the yorker through, but Stokes is able to whip it to deep square leg
back of a length, and clipped off the pads through midwicket
stands tall on the back foot and punches to mid-on
too short and outside leg, Stokes climbs into a greedy pull to the leg-side sweeper
on the pads, flicked to midwicket
down into position early for a flat pulled sweep through midwicket
thumped firmly out to deep midwicket. Stokes nailed that, but the sweeper was in place
that is a snorter! Pitches on off stump, just back of a length, then explodes off the deck to take the shoulder of a startled bat* and fly out the cordon!
cautiously forward, and blocked
turned off the toes into the leg side
full face, and drilled to cover
smacked from a full length into the covers
timed to perfection off the pads
very full again, attacking the pads, worked into the leg side with a swish of the blade
working the singles, diffusing the pressure
poked into the covers, and they jog through once more
down the track, and that is s beautiful strike. Clean as you like, back over the bowler's head. A couple of steps and effortlessly lofted into the stands
good follow-up, working the single out to the leg side
down on one knee, out to square leg
tighter line
good line and length
advancing down the track and drilling a flat drive into the covers
on the pads, working the gap at deep midwicket. Nothing more than a push but the placement was perfect
on the toes, worked into the gap again, and Stokes is picking his prime spot like a German armed with a beach-towel

oops ... well, he was! Aiming in the same direction this time, but carelessly opting for power over placement, and he ended up losing the top of his stumps! The cameraman was deceived, swinging away to the midwicket boundary, but the tell-tale 'plink' of bails was the giveaway...
very full, Buttler leans forward, works a single to midwicket and keeps the strike
outside off, a bit of spin but from back of a length. Buttler waits and dabs to point
solidly forward, blocked into the covers
down on one knee, and swept fine through backward square leg. Well placed
forward and blocked into the leg-side, a bit more over-spin on that delivery
back and across, and defended to point
swept well, to backward square
on the hip, tickled fine through backward square. Off the body this time, so Root doesn't move closer to his hundred after all
solidly into line and defended into the covers
full length, outside off, an expansive drive, but not quite timed
solidly into line
too wide, wafted out to deep point
on the pads, flicked into the leg side

blow me down, Buttler has been run out by a direct hit from backward point! A tap-and-go from Root, and a sharp pick-up-and-shy from Yasir Shah. He was inches short, but I'm not sure he fully sensed the danger
sharp welcome to the crease, climbing into the back pad as Moeen elects to leave on length
tidily into line to defend
on the pads, flicked airily into the leg side, and though they come back for two, another direct hit would have been close! England's running has been a cause for concern in this series
climbing off a good length, angled defence into the leg side
worked off the hip, Wahab's venom isn't being ideally channelled. Another comfortable single to square leg
rides the bounce to claim another single
on the pads, worked into the leg side, England will do it in singles happily enough
defended to third man, another Root trademark nurdle
forward and driven back to the bowler
tightens up in defence on the back foot
a sumptuous drive, Moeen at his best ranks among the most aesthetic sights in sport. Whistling through the covers like a hairy David Gower
stands tall on the back foot to defend to the leg side
appeal for lbw, and given! Moeen reviews as he was struck on the full by an inswinger, could it be missing leg? Indeed it is. On we go...
on the pads, worked into the leg side as Moeen plays with the swing
pulled, but not convincingly...
more feisty pace from a fired-up Wahab, that reprieve seems to have upped his game
a front-foot poke into the covers
short and pulled out to deep midwicket
stands tall to defend off the back foot, and Moeen's exquisite timing and placement beats the fielders as it scurries down the slope
onto the front foot and blocked
a fraction short, pulled firmly but short midwicket pounces to tidy up
on the pads and worked to leg again
solid in defence
another Rootian nurdle down to third man. Arguably his trademark one-day shot, waiting on the back foot for the ball to arrive
short and sharp, Moeen deflects round the corner and excellent scampering to get back for the second
patted down to backward square

a massive mow from a full-length delivery. Root was through his shot early as he sought to close in on his hundred, and emitted a long low groan like a harpooned whale as the ball spiralled into the air and plopped into the hands of cover. The end of another fine match-sealing innings. It looks tight on the scoreline, but it would be remarkable if England lost it from here ...
speared in, but swinging down the leg side, and helped on its way
round the wicket to the incoming Woakes, and finds the edge, but it's played with soft hands and drops well short of slip, A lively finish to his spell, but too little too late for Pakistan
takes the pad, out to the leg-side
in the blockhole, flicked out to midwicket
tight line
compact in defence as Amir fields in his followthrough
blocked into the covers
Woakes sees out the over, and Amir's spell. Ten to win from 24 balls. Wickets or bust for Pakistan
deflected through third man with soft hands. Another one notched off
in the blockhole, Woakes swings through the line to loft an on-drive just out of reach of short midwicket. England are a blow away ...
finds a fat, leading edge through the gap at point. Timed to imperfection down the slope. Moeen didn't know a lot about that one
outside off, a wafty wavy drive, no contact. But it's another no-ball, as called by the third umpire
a big wind-up for the free hit but an excellent slower ball. Takes a thin top edge through the keeper on the bounce
onto the front foot, punched past the bowler in his followthrough
full length, clipped to mid-on, and another dicey single! Moeen would have been miles out if that had hit, but the underarm from Azhar just lobbed over the bails
worked into the leg side, scores are level
chunky defence. The wait goes on
short, and cut fiercely to the point boundary, and that is the end of that!
